intro: Siphocampylus radiatus, commonly known as the radiate siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, typical of the tribe Siphocampylus. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
